newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek PM sworn in with new reform cabinet.
newsitem.headline: Greek PM sworn in with new reform cabinet.

text.p: Greece's socialist Prime Minister Costas Simitis and his new cabinet were sworn in on Wednesday by President Costis Stephanopoulos at the start of their four-year term.

In a televised ceremony, black-clad Orthodox priests chanted a blessing for the new government and Simitis then swore an oath of office. He was followed by his new government's 42 ministers and deputy ministers.
Simitis, 60, won Sunday's national election and has formed a cabinet which mixes experienced ministers with a new generation of reformers who helped to put him in power.
He succeeded party founder and legend Andreas Papandreou as prime minister in January. Simitis gambled on an early vote to cement his grip on power and to choose his own cabinet.

The ceremony marks the start of the post-Papandreou era, with a new generation leader and his hand-picked cabinet setting a firmly pro-Western course and turning thier back on Papandreou's unpredictable, anti-Western ways.
